        Create a new Camera object.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getLerpMaxDistance

        public float getLerpMaxDistance()
        Returns the max distance in tiles before targetPositionUsingLerp(Vector2f, float) directly targets the position instead of using lerp.
        Returns:
        the max distance in tiles.

      • setLerpMaxDistance

        public void setLerpMaxDistance(float lerpMaxDistance)
        Sets the max distance in tiles before targetPositionUsingLerp(Vector2f, float) directly targets the position instead of using lerp.
        Parameters:
        lerpMaxDistance - the max distance in tiles.

      • targetPositionUsingLerp

        public void targetPositionUsingLerp(Vector2f targetPosition,
                                    float deltaTime)
        Targets the camera at the given position using lerp.

        If the target position is greater than getLerpMaxDistance() this method will use targetPosition(Vector2f) instead of using lerp.

        Parameters:
        targetPosition - the target position.
        deltaTime - the time span between the current frame and the last frame in seconds.

      • targetPositionUsingLerp

        public void targetPositionUsingLerp(float x,
                                    float y,
                                    float deltaTime)
        Targets the camera at the given position using lerp.

        If the target position is greater than getLerpMaxDistance() this method will use targetPosition(Vector2f) instead of using lerp.

        Parameters:
        x - the target x position.
        y - the target y position.
        deltaTime - the time span between the current frame and the last frame in seconds.

      • targetPosition

        public void targetPosition(Vector2f targetPosition)
        Targets the camera at the given position.
        Parameters:
        targetPosition - the target position, in tiles.

      • targetPosition

        public void targetPosition(float x,
                           float y)
        Targets the camera at the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - the target x position, in tiles.
        y - the target y position, in tiles.

      • clamp

        public void clamp(int gridWidth,
                  int gridHeight)
        Clamps this camera within the given grid size. This will prevent the camera scrolling of the map.
        Parameters:
        gridWidth - the number of tiles in width.
        gridHeight - the number of tile in height.

      • setViewport

        public void setViewport(int width,
                        int height)
        Sets the viewport size.
        Parameters:
        width - the width in pixels.
        height - the height in pixels.

      • setViewport

        public void setViewport(FlatEngine engine)
        Sets the viewport size to equal the given game engine window.
        Parameters:
        engine - the game engine.

      • getGridPoints

        public int[][] getGridPoints(float gridWidth,
                             float gridHeight)
        Returns the x and y tile ranges for the visible grid tiles in the viewport. Used to render/update the visible tiles only.

        array[0][0] = minimum x
        array[0][1] = maximum x

        array[1][0] = minimum y
        array[1][1] = maximum y

        Parameters:
        gridWidth - the number of tiles in width.
        gridHeight - the number of tiles in height.
        Returns:
        an array containing x and y tile ranges. The array is cached, and updated upon each call.

      • getTranslatedMouse

        public Vector2f getTranslatedMouse(float x,
                                   float y)
        Returns the tile position of the viewport mouse cursor position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x mouse cursor position, in pixels.
        y - the y mouse cursor position, in pixels.
        Returns:
        a cached Vector2f object representing the tile position of the given mouse cursor position.

      • getRenderLocation

        public Vector2i getRenderLocation(float x,
                                  float y)
        Returns the draw location for the given tile position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position, in tiles.
        y - the y position, in tiles.
        Returns:
        a cached Vector2i object representing a tile position in pixels.

      • isOutOfBounds

        public boolean isOutOfBounds(Vector2i pos)
        Returns true if the given position is out of the viewport.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the given position is out of the viewport.
